trend_sources.title: New Social Media Video Creative Trends

creative_patterns: Use of rapid cuts to maintain viewer interest
Incorporating text overlays to emphasize key points
Leveraging popular sounds or songs to enhance engagement
Split-screen to compare or contrast products
Use of behind-the-scenes clips to build authenticity
Interactive elements like polls or questions
Focus on bold and vibrant colors
Use of countdowns to build anticipation
Emotional hook in the first 3 seconds
cadence_rules: Keep initial scenes under 5 seconds to capture attention
Switch scenes or angles every 2-3 seconds
Use overlays for major points, holding for just 1-2 seconds
Maintain a fast-paced rhythm, matching music beats when possible
Include a call to action before the final 3 seconds
Use engaging opening hooks within the first 2-3 seconds
Include visual or auditory changes every 3-5 seconds
End with a strong visual cue or brand element
Utilize seamless loops for videos to replay naturally
Employ silence strategically to emphasize key moments
Build suspense and then release within 10-15 seconds
Alternate between close-up and wide shots every few seconds
do_not_do: Avoid overly long intros, aim for under 3 seconds
Do not use excessive text or cluttered visuals
Avoid jarring or abrupt transitions without context
Do not rely solely on music without narrative or informative elements
Avoid using low-quality or pixelated footage
Do not overuse repetition, it can lead to viewer drop-off
Avoid generic content that lacks a unique angle
Do not neglect closed captioning, accessibility is key
Avoid using copyrighted music that can lead to removal
Do not mimic trends without adapting them to your brand
Avoid being off-brand; maintain consistent visuals and tone
Do not ignore engagement; respond to comments and feedback
Avoid ignoring analytics; adjust strategies based on data insights
Do not underestimate the power of the thumbnail or cover image
